MenuItem.Description: Represents a simple custom link with a text and an url.

HtmlMenuItem.Description: Renders some custom HTML in the menu.

ShapeMenuItem.Description: Injects menu items from a Shape

ContentMenuItem.Description: Adds a Content Item to the menu.

NavigationQueryMenuItem.Description: Injects menu items from a Query

CommonPart.ContentPartSettings.Description: Provides common information about a content item, such as Owner, Date Created, Date Published and Date Modified.

WidgetPart.ContentPartSettings.Description: Turns a content type into a Widget. Note: you need to set the stereotype to "Widget" as well.

MenuPart.ContentPartSettings.Description: Provides an easy way to create a ContentMenuItem from the content editor.

IdentityPart.ContentPartSettings.Description: Automatically generates a unique identity for the content item, which is required in import/export scenarios where one content item references another.

TitlePart.ContentPartSettings.Description: Provides a Title for your content item.

BodyPart.ContentPartSettings.Description: Allows the editing of text using an editor provided by the configured flavor (e.g. html, text, markdown).

AutoroutePart.ContentPartSettings.Description: Adds advanced url configuration options to your content type to completely customize the url pattern for a content item.

BlogPart.ContentPartSettings.Description: Turns content types into a Blog.

AdminMenuPart.ContentPartSettings.Description: Adds a menu item to the Admin menu that links to this content item.

CommentsContainerPart.ContentPartSettings.Description: Adds support to a content type to contain comments.

BlogPostPart.ContentPartSettings.Description: Turns content types into a BlogPost.

CommentsPart.ContentPartSettings.Description: Allows content items to be commented on.

RecentBlogPostsPart.ContentPartSettings.Description: Renders a list of recent blog posts.

BlogArchivesPart.ContentPartSettings.Description: Renders an archive of posts for a blog.

CommentPart.ContentPartSettings.Description: Used by the Comment content type.

MediaSettingsPart.UploadAllowedFileTypeWhitelist: jpg jpeg gif png txt doc docx xls xlsx pdf ppt pptx pps ppsx odt ods odp

BodyPart.Text:
You've successfully setup your Orchard Site and this is the homepage of your new site. Here are a few things you can look at to get familiar with the application. Once you feel confident you don't need this anymore, you can remove it by going into editing mode and replacing it with whatever you want.

First things first - You'll probably want to manage your settings and configure Orchard to your liking. After that, you can head over to manage themes to change or install new themes and really make it your own. Once you're happy with a look and feel, it's time for some content. You can start creating new custom content types or start from the built-in ones by adding a page, or managing your menus.

Finally, Orchard has been designed to be extended. It comes with a few built-in modules such as pages and blogs or themes. If you're looking to add additional functionality, you can do so by creating your own module or by installing one that somebody else built. Modules are created by other users of Orchard just like you so if you feel up to it, please consider participating.

Thanks for using Orchard – The Orchard Team

LayerPart.Name: Default
LayerPart.Description: The widgets in this layer are displayed on all pages

LayerPart.Name: Authenticated
LayerPart.Description: The widgets in this layer are displayed when the user is authenticated

LayerPart.Name: Anonymous
LayerPart.Description: The widgets in this layer are displayed when the user is anonymous

LayerPart.Name: Disabled
LayerPart.Description: The widgets in this layer are never displayed

LayerPart.Name: TheHomepage
LayerPart.Description: The widgets in this layer are displayed on the home page

LayerPart.Name: NotTheHomepage
LayerPart.Description: The widgets in this layer are displayed on every page except the home page

BodyPart.Text:
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Pellentesque a est enim. Morbi congue metus id ante fermentum eu imperdiet ligula varius. Suspendisse potenti. Sed laoreet augue eu neque tincidunt gravida. Nullam rutrum auctor consequat. Aenean id arcu dolor, et sollicitudin dui. Morbi suscipit dui libero, quis rhoncus leo. Sed feugiat tellus ac metus rhoncus vitae tristique enim malesuada. Nunc magna nibh, tristique ac volutpat sed, pellentesque at libero. Donec quis velit nec metus fermentum tincidunt. Maecenas vitae urna leo. Vivamus sagittis, sapien et aliquet posuere, lorem lacus eleifend dui, in malesuada odio nunc at nisi. Sed dictum bibendum dui, quis fringilla dolor scelerisque a. Praesent nisl lorem, mattis quis tempus non, accumsan nec quam.

Sed suscipit, nisi eu eleifend accumsan, sapien leo eleifend risus, vitae ultricies lorem eros a augue. Integer molestie vestibulum purus eu semper. Duis id tortor nec ligula tincidunt suscipit eu nec mi. Etiam sit amet fermentum arcu. Aenean molestie pellentesque lacus, a imperdiet risus euismod vitae. Morbi lobortis varius magna, vel imperdiet urna mattis at. Vestibulum rhoncus venenatis sem in scelerisque. Sed sagittis suscipit aliquet. Duis sed erat vel odio tempus porta eget vitae augue.

{
    alert("Wow!");
}

Since the item's title is an H1 itself, this is not adviced.

Attention! Actual information here!

This Orchard application is set up with a variety of test contents so you can use it to test your theme and layout. The content includes a varied main menu and a foot menu, items of the most used content types and widgets and typography tests.

The content of this Orchard site is distributed as an export file as part of the Orchard Dojo Library and is open source. If you have found any errors or would like to add something to it you're more than welcome to fork the library and edit the export xml.

You can log in with the credentials admin/password and play with the content yourself.

Created by Lombiq for the fellow Orchard enthusiasts.

TitlePart.Title: Welcome to the Orchard Content Test!
